titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Printed Ephemera Related to African American Political Activism and Arts
Printed Ephemera Related to African American Political Activism and Arts
titlestmt.author: by Matthew D. Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:43

did.unittitle: Printed ephemera of African American political activism and arts

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Printed ephemera related to African American political activism and arts primarily in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, circa 1913-1990, with the bulk of the material from 1963 to 1976. Significant organizations documented in the collection include the Philadelphia chapters of the Black Panther Party and Peace and Freedom Party, as well as local and national electoral campaigns of the Communist Party of the United States of America. Many of the items document speakers and events sponsored by political, art, and social pressure groups. Items include handbills, leaflets, direct mail, posters, and other printed ephemera.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Reese Company on the James Weldon Johnson Memorial Collection of Negro Arts & Letters Fund, 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Printed Ephemera Related to African American Political Activism and Arts collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Printed Ephemera Related to African American Political Activism and Arts. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed ephemera related to African American political activism and arts primarily in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, circa 1913-1990, with the bulk of the material from 1963 to 1976. Significant organizations documented in the collection include the Philadelphia chapters of the Black Panther Party and Peace and Freedom Party, as well as local and national electoral campaigns of the Communist Party of the United States of America. Many of the items document speakers and events sponsored by political, art, and social pressure groups. Items include handbills, leaflets, direct mail, posters, and other printed ephemera

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three series according to size to faciliate its storage and handling.

did.unittitle: Ephemera

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by by the corporate name, and in a few instances the personal surname, of the creator or title of a serial, and chronologically therein, followed by ephemera with unidentified creators arranged chronologically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the corporate name of the creator, and chronologically therein, followed by very large oversize ephemera in broadside folders.
